creator: clarkekeir

title: fallo en la descarga de certificado digital de persona física
content:
Buenos días, tengo un mac y estoy intentado descargarme el certificado digital de persona física a través de la pagina de la casa de la moneda y timbre y sale que no es una conexión segura.

Firefox ha detectado una potencial amenaza de seguridad y no ha continuado a www.sede.fnmt.gob.es porque este sitio web requiere una conexión segura.

¿Qué puede hacer al respecto?

www.sede.fnmt.gob.es tiene una política de seguridad llamada HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS), que significa que Firefox solo puede conectarse a él de forma segura. No puede añadir una excepción para visitar este sitio.

El problema está probablemente en el sitio web, y no hay nada que pueda hacer para resolverlo.

Si está en una red corporativa o utilizando un antivirus, puede ponerse en contacto con el equipo de asistencia para obtener ayuda. También puede notificar el problema al administrador del sitio web.

No se como resolverlo, un saludo.
creator: aligube2

title: Firefox doesn't recognize internet has returned after some time
content:
Basically, if I lose internet and firefox realizes I've lost internet, it refuses actually attempting to connect to the network and load web pages.

This would be fine if it checked more often, however if i lose internet, lets say even for 5 seconds, once i get it back it can take anywhere from 30 seconds to a full minute it seems for me to attempt to load a webpage again.

Due to the nature of the internet I use while at work, this happens fairly often. Restarting firefox is the fastest way for me to get it to check for an internet connection again, but I was hoping there was an option in "about:config" i could use to have it check faster.

title: Have been trying to overcome/identify issues using Ancestry.Com with Firefox

Most of the system works fine , except for their internal mail system and graphics.

When I copied some of the text produced (i.e. graphics) into BBEdit, I was able to isolate and produce a graphics output, so I am stumped.

When I spent hours trying to interact with Ancestry, all they do is to send links to FAQ (the same one form different issues) indicating that their 'Tech Support' is less than basic. they of course indicate that Firefox is the issue, but i don't believe this is the case.

BTW Ancestry recommends the use of Firefox as the browser of choice.

regards

Jim

title: Firefox displaying connection reset errors, but Opera works fine
content:
Firefox has been working for years on this PC since I bought it.

Today when I try to access say, google.com, or any other URL in Firefox , the browser returns "The connection was reset" and fails to load the page or any other.

I installed Opera and it works fine ....

I can access any other internet resource from the PC, e.g FTP, Remote MySQL, I can ping domains e.g. google.com

In FF I Flushed entire cache - no change.

I have uninstalled FF, removed Mozilla in %Programdata%, %Appdata% and all registry entries then re-installed FF , but still getting "The connection was reset" ...

Switched off Kaspersky - no change

Windows 10 22H2 (19045.2604)
creator: upsalla
